head.supplied: Melbourne botanic Garden ¶ 29 Aug. 1870 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In accordance with your instructions ¶ I have the honor of submitting herewith an estimate of expenditure in the botanic Garden during the first hal...

div.p: W70/10298, unit 505, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In accordance with your instructions
See W. Odgers to M, 26 August 1870. I have the honor of submitting herewith an estimate of expenditure in the botanic Garden during the first half of the year 1871. This estimate might still be further decreased, if it met with your pleasure, to restrict the duties of the Inspector of forests to the surveillance over the woods of the colony, a measure, which I beg to recommend to your favorable consideration, and which would need, that provision should be made for this officer by the Lands Department.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

Melbourne Botanic Garden
Estimate is on a separate sheet, in a different hand.

div.p:
*The item of £125. as salary for the Inspector of Forests is again introduced on this estimate, simply in conformity with last year's schedule, although the director of the Bot. Garden respectfully submits that the support of this officer here entails since last year an expenditure on his department, which perfectly well can be saved to the Garden vote, and the Honorable the Chief Secretary will therefore perhaps be pleased to take into consideration, whether it would not be better to make provision for this officer in the Lands Department, where the increasing forest interests would be certain to absorb all his time and attention.
Across this note, McCulloch has written: 'What is the use of Dr Mueller wasting Govt time in writing this minute - he well knows the intention of Govt and Parliament J McC'.
